title: Google Forum Alternatives: Free & Easy to Use

steps.title: Go to https://groups.google.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://groups.google.com in a web browser. While Google removed the forum setting and many forum-like features, you can still create a discussion group that people can join. Google Groups are mainly used over email, but members can visit the group's webpage to read, post, and reply to topics.

steps.title: Click Create Group.
steps.content: Click Create Group . It's next to a multicolored plus sign on the left side of your window.

steps.title: Set up your Group.
steps.content: Set up your Group. Give the group a name, a group email address, and a description. Click Next to continue and customize your group more. You can choose the Group's privacy settings on the second page, including who can view or create posts. Click Next to continue.

steps.title: Add members.
steps.content: Add members. Enter the email addresses or Gmail contacts to add to the group. You can personalize the invitation by adding a message. Click the toggle next to "Directly add members" to switch between adding the members or sending them an invitation. Depending on the setting you choose, the text field will change between, "Welcome message" and "Invitation message."

steps.title: Click Create Group.
steps.content: Click Create Group . If you opted for the members to get invites, they need to check their emails and accept the invitation before they can access your Group (they might end up in Spam or other places!) Once members have joined, you can view your Google Groups at https://groups.google.com . Click on the Group, and then you can join the conversations or start a new one! [2] X Research source

steps.title: If you want a web-based discussion forum, there are other options.
steps.content: If you want a web-based discussion forum, there are other options. Now that Google has no forum feature, you can't pin topics, keep discussions on the web only, or use categories and tags. If you want to create a free forum that is more like a message board, try one of these alternatives: Reddit. Create your own sub-Reddit to use the existing Reddit tools, like profiles, usernames, and design elements while hosting your online discussion. Simply click Create a Community on the left side of your window if your account is eligible. [3] X Research source Forumotion ProBoards Site123 Boardhost Bravenet
